documentType: court filing with attached business records
summary: This document is a 2020 response from the Virgin Islands Lieutenant Governor's Office to a court subpoena regarding Southern Country International Ltd. (SCI), an International Financial Services Entity. It includes a certificate of authenticity and an attached 2013 application for Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG), which lists Jeffrey Epstein as its 100% owner and president. This document is part of an application package for the Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG) to obtain an International Banking Entity license in the U.S. Virgin Islands. It includes the Articles of Incorporation for FSG, a biographical affidavit from Jeffrey Epstein (the sole shareholder and president), and supporting information about the company's proposed activities and officers. The document reveals Epstein's central role in the entity and provides details about his background, his 2008 guilty plea, and his financial operations in the Virgin Islands. A later Certificate of Licensure shows a related entity, Southern Country International, Ltd., was licensed in 2019.

persons.role: Attorney at Kellerhals Ferguson Fletcher Krobun LLP
persons.context: Attorney who submitted the 2013 application for Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG) to operate as an International Banking Entity. She signed the application as the authorized representative.

persons.role: President and 100% Owner of Financial Strategy Group, Ltd.

persons.context: Listed as the proposed Treasurer of FSG. His educational background (Syracuse University, Pace University) and CPA certification are provided.

events.title: FSG Banking Entity Application Filed
events.description: Attorney Erika Kellerhals submits an application to the Virgin Islands Division of Banking & Insurance for Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG) to operate as an International Banking Entity.

events.title: SCI Licensed as IFSE
events.description: Southern Country International Ltd. (SCI) is licensed as an International Financial Services Entity in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: SCI License Surrendered
events.description: Southern Country International Ltd. (SCI) surrenders its Virgin Islands financial license without having reported commencing statutory operations.

events.title: Subpoena Issued for SCI Records
events.description: The District Court of the Virgin Islands issues a subpoena to the Lieutenant Governor's Office for all documents pertaining to Southern Country International Ltd. (SCI).

events.title: Government Response to Subpoena
events.description: The Office of the Lieutenant Governor, via Dolace McLean, responds to the court subpoena regarding SCI, providing information and attached historical records.

events.title: Incorporation of Financial Strategy Group, Ltd.
events.description: Articles of Incorporation for Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. are executed by incorporators Erika A. Kellerhals, Brett A. Geary, and Nicole Miller.

events.title: Epstein Submits Biographical Affidavit
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signs a detailed biographical affidavit as part of the application for an International Banking Entity license for Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. The affidavit includes his personal history, business background, and details of his 2008 criminal conviction.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty and was convicted in Florida state court of one count of solicitation of prostitution and one count of procuring prostitution of a person under the age of 18. He served 13 months in jail.

events.title: Licensure of Southern Country International, Ltd.
events.description: The Virgin Islands Banking Board, chaired by Lt. Governor Tregenza A. Roach, issues a Certificate of Licensure to Southern Country International, Ltd. as an international financial services entity, valid for 2019.

St. Thomas, Charlotte Amalie (Government of the Virgin Islands seat)
Palm Beach County, Florida (location of 2005-2008 investigation and prosecution)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the 100% owner and president of Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG), a company that applied in 2013 to become a licensed International Banking Entity in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Epstein associates Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn are listed as Secretary and Treasurer, respectively, of the proposed FSG entity.

The document is part of a 2020 court subpoena response concerning a different but related entity, Southern Country International Ltd. (SCI), which surrendered its financial license in 2019 without ever reporting it began operations.
The attached 2013 application shows Epstein's attempt to establish a formal offshore financial entity in the Virgin Islands through legal counsel Erika Kellerhals.

Jeffrey Epstein was the sole shareholder and proposed president of Financial Strategy Group, Ltd. (FSG), an entity applying for an International Banking Entity license in the U.S. Virgin Islands in 2013.

In his biographical affidavit, Epstein disclosed his 2008 Florida state convictions for solicitation of prostitution and procuring prostitution of a minor, serving 13 months in jail, and stated the federal investigation into the same matters was discontinued without charges.

The application materials detail Epstein's business history, including his start at Bear Stearns, founding his own financial consulting firm, and moving it to the Virgin Islands in 1999 as Financial Trust Company, Inc. (FTC).

A separate entity, Southern Country International, Ltd., received an International Financial Services Entity license from the Virgin Islands Banking Board in March 2019, with records showing annual license fee payments of $70,000-$75,000.

Epstein listed his memberships in elite organizations like the Trilateral Commission, Council on Foreign Relations, and boards at Rockefeller University and Harvard, and provided James E. Staley and Andrew Farkas as personal references.
